title: Alan Neil
text:
Alan Neil (born 27 January 1957) is an Australian former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s.
Playing career.
A ginger headed halfback, Neil was a regular first grade player during the late 1970 and early 1980s. He played six seasons for <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs</a> between 1977 and 1982, and became the club halfback after <a href="Tommy%20Raudonikis">Tommy Raudonikis</a> moved to the <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a> club in 1980.
He also was the first grade halfback for the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs Roosters</a> for two seasons between 1983 and 1984, and finished his career at the <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George Dragons</a> in 1985. Neil was a reserve in the <a href="1985%20NSWRL%20season">1985 Grand Final</a>.
Alan Neil was the elder brother of former <a href="Balmain%20Tigers">Balmain</a> halfback <a href="Mick%20Neil">Mick Neil</a>.
